summary: The Remote Access Security Act (H.R. 2683) amends the Export Control Reform Act of 2018 to control remote access of items subject to U.S. jurisdiction by foreign persons. The bill defines "remote access" and modifies various sections of the Act to include remote access within the scope of export controls, covering access via networks like the internet. It adjusts existing regulations related to export, in-country transfer and now remote access to ensure compliance. The bill also specifies regulations by the Secretary.
